result.execSummary:
The defendant Reynaldo Miranda Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay $1,500.00 fine plus costs.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
-------------------------------

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
-------------------------------

in the Walworth County Jail with Huber privileges to commence on or before 06/27/2016 at 8:00 a.m.  IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess Huber funds be applied toward any and all outstanding restitution, fines/costs while serving his/her mandatory jail sentence. **AMENDMENT 06-24-2016 - IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's turn in date is amended to July 11, 2016 @ 8:00 a.m.**

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Reynaldo Miranda Jr.

8:32 am  Court in session.  Case Called.  Appearances given.  
Andrew R Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Reynaldo  Miranda in court with Atty Jeffrey L Hahn.  
Matter is before the Court for Sentencing.  
Parties advise they have a joint agreement.
Attorney Hahn recites terms of their agreement.  
Defendant does not wish to make a statement.  
Court imposes the agreed upon sentence.  

Fourteen (14) days in the Walworth County Jail with Huber privileges
One (1) day sentence credit.  
Jail to commence on or before June 27, 2016 at 8:00 am
Pay $1,500 fine plus court costs
Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.  

8:34 am  Court in recess.
Defendant Reynaldo  Miranda in court with attorney Jeffrey L Hahn.  Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Reynaldo  Miranda in court with attorney Jeffrey L Hahn.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Not guilty plea entered. Minutes filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 11, 2016 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for May 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Reynaldo  Miranda in court with attorney Jeffrey L Hahn.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Not guilty plea entered. Motion deadline 03-17-16. Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for March 17, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

940 am case called. Appearances made. 
Defendant Reynaldo Miranda in court with attorney Jeff Hahn. ADA Haley Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives his right to preliminary hearing. Court reviews preliminary hearing questionnaire and waiver form with defendant. 
Defendant bound over for trial. 
Information filed. 
Arraignment scheduled. 
943 am court in recess. Arraignment scheduled for January 28, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Reynaldo Miranda in court with attorney Jeffrey L Hahn.  Valerian A Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Defendant Reynaldo Miranda Jr present in court. Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.
Signed bond filed with the court.

MUST POST $3000.00 CASH
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall have "0" blood alcohol in his/her body whenever driving/operating a motor vehicle.  Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
